m:MaterialTitle.title: TextBox
m:MaterialTitle.description: Text fields allow user input. The border should light up simply and clearly indicating which field the user is currently editing.

m:MaterialTitle.title: Placeholder and Label
m:MaterialTitle.description: There are two types of showing labels to the textbox, the floating inline labels move to float above the field. While the other is called Placeholder or Hint Text which will be hidden once user types on the textbox.

m:MaterialRow.demo:PrettyPre:
<m:MaterialTextBox label="This is a label" grid="s12"/>
<m:MaterialTextBox placeholder="This is a placeholder" grid="s12"/>
<m:MaterialTextBox placeholder="This is an active textbox" label="This is a label" active="true" />

m:MaterialTitle.title: Textarea
m:MaterialTitle.description: Textareas allow larger expandable user input. The border should light up simply and clearly indicating which field the user is currently editing.

m:MaterialTitle.title: Textarea
m:MaterialTitle.description: Textareas use a resize policy that can be configured to suit your need.

m:MaterialTitle.title: Character Counter
m:MaterialTitle.description: Use a character counter in fields where a character restriction is in place.

m:MaterialRow.demo:PrettyPre:
<m:MaterialTextBox label="Input Text" length="10"/>
<m:MaterialTextArea label="Text Area" length="120"/>

m:MaterialTitle.title: Number Value Box
m:MaterialTitle.description: We provided additional value boxes : Material Float, Integer, Double and Long boxes for specific data format.

m:MaterialRow.m.demo:PrettyPre:
<!-- MaterialNumber boxes -->
<m:MaterialTitle title="Number Value Box" description="We provided additional value boxes : Material Float, Integer, Double and Long boxes for specific data format." />
<!-- Float box -->
<m:MaterialFloatBox ui:field="txtFloatBox" label="Float value"/>
<!-- Integer box -->
<m:MaterialIntegerBox ui:field="txtIntegerBox" label="Integer value"/>
<!-- Double box -->
<m:MaterialDoubleBox ui:field="txtDoubleBox" label="Double value"/>
<!-- Long Box -->
<m:MaterialLongBox ui:field="txtLongBox" label="Long value"/>
txtFloatBox.setValue(1000.25f);
txtIntegerBox.setValue(10);
txtDoubleBox.setValue(9999.90);
txtLongBox.setValue((long) 1000.00);

m:MaterialTitle.title: Disabled Styles
m:MaterialTitle.description: You can disable any text field by adding enabled='false'

m:MaterialRow.demo:PrettyPre:
<m:MaterialTextBox enabled="false" label="TextBox" />
<m:MaterialTextArea enabled="false" label="TextArea" />
<m:MaterialFloatBox enabled="false" label="FloatBox"/>
<m:MaterialIntegerBox enabled="false" label="IntegerBox"/>
<m:MaterialDoubleBox enabled="false" label="DoubleBox"/>
<m:MaterialLongBox enabled="false" label="LongBox"/>

m:MaterialTitle.title: ReturnValueAsNull
m:MaterialTitle.description: With this attribute set to true a call to getValue() returns null when the validator obtained by createBlankValidator() recognizes the value as blank. You can use this attribute for non-mandatory input fields that have @Pattern constraint, like an e-mail or phone input. This way you avoid the @Pattern#regexp being matched against an empty string when your user does not enter a value into such input.
